title: Maple Bourbon Bacon
directions: Remove the skin and use it to make cracklins (have the butcher do this)
Pour everything except the meat into a zipper bag large enough to hold the belly
Mix all ingredients and add the pork belly
Coat the pork belly, and then remove all air from the bag, then continue to massage the belly
Place in the fridge for 3-5 days (removing to massage every day or two)
Remove the belly and discard liquid
Smoke over indirect heat at around 225°F until the internal temp is 150°F (about 2 hours)
Slice off the ends, which may be very dark and more heavily seasoned
Let it cool on a plate in the fridge before cutting

Wrap it tightly with several layers of plastic wrap, and then a layer of foil, and refrigerate for up to 2 weeks or freeze for up to 3 months. Do not wrap in foil alone because it can react with the salt.
